result.title: Expand%20Validator%20Set%20to%20160-175
result.plaintext:
The purpose of this thread is to start a discussion on expanding the EVMOS validator set.

There are currently 150 validators. However, there are several quality ones that are just outside the active set. A few who are well outside the active set aren't even attempting to join because, due to massive APR, the barrier to entry is so high.

EVMOS is a new chain and growing rapidly. It has become one of the main chains that new validators join. We should be encouraging quality developers to get involved in the ecosystem, maybe even incentivizing Ethereum developers to join (another Prop?) in.

What better way to start getting involved than by helping secure the chain?

Please share your thoughts on pros and cons of expanding the validator set in the comments.

result.title: Raise%20Governance%20Proposal%20Deposit%20from%2064%20EVMOS%20to%20300%20EVMOS
result.plaintext:
The purpose of this proposal is to raise the min governance deposit from 64 EVMOS to 300 EVMOS (~$675).

64 EVMOS (~$140) is much lower than other large chains (500 JUNO is ~$1200, 64 ATOM is ~$500, 500 OSMO is ~$400)

Current deposit amount makes it easy for bad actors to spam governance with low-quality proposals or advertisements

While it's important to keep governance inclusive, it's crucial to incentivize high-quality contributions. Given that multiple parties can propose governance together and split the deposit, I think 300 EVMOS is a good balance of the equities.

Please share your thoughts.

result.title: [Passed] Raise the Proposal Deposit Amount to 192 EVMOS
result.plaintext:
While we do not want to create an intimidatingly high barrier of entry for those that wish to submit a proposal,  Proposal 38 has shown utter disrespect to the community and is an embarrassment to the chain. While mistakes do happen, and while proposals can unknowingly be posted without following the suggested guidelines, this was certainly not either of those. This was a deliberate exploitation of the current parameters set in place to encourage proposals. We do not endorse censorship, nor do we have the means to remove the spam, but I'm afraid that there could be more copy-cat attempts now that the public has seen the ease of submitting a proposal. 

What does the community think about tripling the deposit amount? Or perhaps even higher? 

Reasoning: If a proposal follows the recommended guidelines, then surely there will be validators on board before it goes to vote. Thus, even if the deposit amount is set high, the actual proposer would not have to deposit the full amount, or any amount at all -- rather, validators or anyone in the community in support of the proposal would step in and make the deposit. This would hopefully ensure that these types of spam will not be a reoccurring nuisance, and encourage the usage of the recommended proposal lifecycles.

result.title: Delay Rektdrop Decay Date to Aug 1st
result.plaintext:
OVERVIEW

This thread aims at gauging community sentiment around pushing back the decay date for the Rektdrop so more users have time to claim their airdrop. Users have experienced barriers to claiming the airdrop that haven't all been fixed as we approach the beginning of decay, and we want to give every user a fair chance at claiming their portion of the Rektdrop.

ABSTRACT

The Rektdrop is set to begin decay on Sunday July 3, 2022 where users who have not claimed their tokens yet will begin to see a small percentage " and start go be directed back towards the community pool. We are now less than 4 days from the start and there are still issues that are preventing users from claiming their full share of the Rektdrop.

The team has made the proper fixes for most of these issue in the upcoming upgrade on Monday July 4th, 2022, but the unclaimed airdrop amounts will begin to decay at no fault of the users even before this upgrade takes place. Community members have expressed concerns over this, and have proposed moving back the decay date to a later date and to reimburse the decayed tokens.

PLAN OF ACTION

We delay the start of the Rektdrop decay to begin on Monday August 1st, 2022.

Signal commitment to reimburse anyone who experienced decay on their airdrop before the newly set date of Monday August 1st, 2022 . These tokens will be reimbursed from the community pool at a later date after all the data is gathered and verified.

We fast track this proposal on chain if there are no concerns or red flags from the community to limit the amount of decay users experience and make step 2 simpler.

This will not only ensure users don't experience decay at no fault of their own, but also give more time for new users to claim this airdrop to promote healthy token distribution for Evmos.

SUMMARY

We push back the Rektdropt decay date to begin on Monday August 1st, 2022 @ approximately 09:00 UTC. We signal agreement that any user who experienced decay before the newly set decay date should have those tokens reimbursed by the community pool at a later time after we gather the proper info and come up with the plan to send these funds back.

Considering the start of decay being less than the socially agreed 3 days for a commonwealth discussion, we may fast track this proposal on chain to limit the decay for users if there is no opposition from community members.

I will update the thread with relevant information and decisions as the discussion matures and it is needed. Feedback back is encouraged and welcomed :)

result.title: Global Min Gas Price value for Cosmos SDK and EVM transaction: choosing a value
result.plaintext:
[update] new poll: PLEASE VOTE

Summary

The `MinGasPrice` sets a minimum gas price for transactions (both Cosmos SDK and EVM). The `MinGasPrice` value has priority over other settings: gas price cannot go lower than it, otherwise, the transaction will fail.

I programmed by myself this feature ( https://github.com/tharsis/evmos/pull/610 , later moved to https://github.com/tharsis/ethermint/pull/1104 ), as a volunteer effort.

Specs

Read about the `MinGasPrice`:

- https://docs.evmos.org/modules/feemarket/01_concepts.html#global-minimum-gas-price

- https://docs.evmos.org/modules/feemarket/09_antehandlers.html

- about EVM dynamic (eip-1559) transactions: https://github.com/tharsis/ethermint/blob/23f88315e84d8de74679db02171aee489b30b808/app/ante/fees.go#L109-L116

Choosing a value

I suggest choosing a higher value at first, then a lower value when the price of EVMOS increases.

In order for you to make an informed decision, I prepared a playground for anyone to check the gas prices and test different `MinGasPrice` values: https://observablehq.com/@loredanacirstea/evm-gas-prices

result.title: Enable inflation module
result.plaintext:
Hi all,

I want to start a discussion on enabling the inflation module on Evmos Mainnet.

Why?

When the chain initially launched, the inflation module was enabled and new Evmos tokens were minted and allocated according to the Evmos Token Model once a day until the chain halted.

After the halt, Evmos relaunched with the inflation module disabled for two main reasons:

ensure that the chain is secure and chain upgrades are successful

give more time to those who hadn't been able to claim their airdrop

Now, that several upgrades have passed successfully and more users have claimed their airdrop, inflation could be enabled. Enabling the inflation module would mean, that

staking rewards,

usage incentives and

community pool allocation

are enabled.

Testing on Testnet

With proposal 28 the inflation module has already been enabled on Testnet. Please take part in testing its correctness by

staking tokens: You should receive staking rewards once a day

interacting with registered usage incentives: You should be able to query your gas meters after interacting with an incentivized smart contract. Once a week, your gas meters are reset and you receive Evmos tokens from the incentives pool based on how much gas you spent on interacting with incentivized smart contracts. The incentives pool fills up once a day through inflation

querying the community pool: a part of inflation is allocated in the community pool once a day. Query the community pool to make sure it's increasing according to the Evmos Token Model .

Note, that the team allocation of the Evmos Token Model is not handled through inflation but instead was implemented with vesting accounts .

Discussion

Before voting on the Mainnet proposal please follow and discuss this proposal on this page. For an in-depth explanation of the module, please refer to the module specification .

result.title: Stricter Slashing for Validators Missing Blocks
result.plaintext:
This post is somewhat related to and goes some way towards addressing the concerns brought up in this post.

Assuming an average 6.5s block time on mainnet (evmos_9001-2), active validators can get away with only signing half of the blocks in a ~54 hour window without being slashed. In my humble opinion, this is far too lenient and discourages validators in the active set from taking the proper precautions for ensuring maximum uptime and service continuity. These precautions include: setting up monitoring, beefing up hardware, exchanging tips with and seeking advice from other validators, etc. It also contributes to a less competitive validator landscape that ultimately jeopardizes the security of the network and allows inactive validators to linger in the safety of the top 50 validator slots.

To alleviate this, I recommend the following changes:

SignedBlocksWindow : change from "30000" to "10000".

MinSignedPerWindow : change from "0.500000000000000000" to "0.050000000000000000"

This would effectively cut down on the number of blocks validators are allowed to miss in a specified window. You can find out more about the slashing modulein the corresponding specification . For reference, these are the current Evmos params:

evmosd query slashing params --node=https://tendermint.bd.evmos.org:26657/ --output=json | jq . { "signed_blocks_window": "30000", "min_signed_per_window": "0.500000000000000000", "downtime_jail_duration": "1800s", "slash_fraction_double_sign": "0.100000000000000000", "slash_fraction_downtime": "0.005000000000000000" }

The proposed values are similar to those of the Cosmos Hub (you can see all Cosmos Hub params here ):

curl -X GET "https://api.cosmos.network/cosmos/slashing/v1beta1/params" -H "accept: application/json" { "params": { "signed_blocks_window": "10000", "min_signed_per_window": "0.050000000000000000", "downtime_jail_duration": "600s", "slash_fraction_double_sign": "0.050000000000000000", "slash_fraction_downtime": "0.000100000000000000" } }

I imagine that some leniency is still necessary early on, given the recent pains with network congestion and the absolutely monstrous rate of state bloat Evmos validators have had to deal with. As active validators acclimate to the challenges of running a chain like Evmos, I imagine the community will want to increase the MinSignedPerWindow .

Unlike other parameter change proposals, we should NOT make the same proposal to testnet (evmos_9000-4) as both test and main networks have different uptime expectations from their validators and slashing carries different consequences.

Thoughts?

result.title: Enable%20erc20%20module
result.plaintext:
Hey everyone,

I'd like to start discussion here to prepare for enabling the ERC20 Module. The ERC20 Module is used for being able to convert Cosmos ICS20 tokens to ERC20 tokens and vise versa so that dapps on Evmos can incorporate cosmos assets such as ATOM, OSMO, UST. More details can be found in this blog post .

In order to activate the module, an on-chain proposal will take place after an upcoming upgrade to turn on the module. Once done, additional proposals can be made to whitelist specific tokens either from the Cosmos side or from the EVM side.

result.title: Extend%20Claims%20Period%20by%2021%20days
result.plaintext:
Hello Evmos community,

The core Evmos team is proposing to extend the claims period by 21 days, in order to give Cosmos Hub and Osmosis eligible addresses ample time to claim their airdrop allocations. We recommend the following changes:

DurationUntilDecay : change from "3801600s" to "5616000s".

This will result in a total of 65 days from the claim start time (2022-04-29 at 16:00 UTC) for users to claim their EVMOS tokens before the decay period begins (for a duration of 60 days).

As with other parameter change proposals, we will make the same proposal to testnet (evmos_9000-4) to ensure both networks are up to date.

You can find out more about the claims modulein the corresponding specification .

topic.name: 5. Param Change
topic.description: For any discussions for governance proposals that propose changing Evmos parameters

result.title: Change x/feemarket Parameters to Improve Tx Fees
result.plaintext:
Hello Evmosians,

The core team is currently investigating the recent network congestion and is coding up a solution that may take some time to go live. In the meantime, they've identified some parameter changes in the feemarket module that may go a long way towards ensuring transaction fees behave correctly and increase in proportion to demand for block space.

The team recommends the following changes:

BaseFee: change from "36" to "1000000000" (one billion). This is the default used for networks like Ethereum.

ElasticityMultiplier: change from "2" to "4". This will make the base fee more responsive to network usage.

If the community is in favor, I will move to put a proposal on-chain to enact the above changes. At the same time, I will make the same proposal to testnet (evmos_9000-4) in order to prove out this theory. The testnet changes can be made in 6 hours (whereas mainnet changes take 5 days), so there should be ample time to vote down the mainnet proposal if the parameter changes on testnet do not have the intended effect. Note that the efficacy of testing these changes on testnet is limited as testnet does not currently see the same transaction volume as mainnet.

You can find out more about the feemarket module in the docs , and descriptions for the above parameters here .

result.title: This proposal creates and registers an ERC-20 representation for Kujiras USD stablecoin (USK)
result.plaintext:
Hey Hey Hey

More stablecoins coming to Evmos!

**What is USK:**
Kujira $USK is a native Cosmos overcollateralized stablecoin soft-pegged to the US dollar, initially backed by $ATOM. Users stake collateral to mint $USK while users would burn $USK to redeem their collateral.

**Proposal:**
We at Swiss Staking will make a proposal next week to register Kujira's stablecoin (USK) as an ERC-20 token on Evmos. Once the proposal is approved by the EVMOS governance, the ERC-20 uses a factory pattern to deploy an ERC20 token contract representation of the USK stablecoin. More info regarding x/erc20 modulehere.
Main benefits for doing so:
- Users will be able to swap Evmos with USK on Evmos itself (giving USK access to DeFi protocols, NFT).
- Build new applications that are based on ERC-20 smart contracts and have access to the Cosmos ecosystem

result.title: Registration%20for%20Stride%20assets%20STRD%2C%20stATOM%2C%20stJUNO%2C%20stOSMO%2C%20and%20stSTARS%20ERC20%20Representations.
result.plaintext:
Overview

This thread is beginning the process to enable the creation of ERC20 representations for the upcoming liquid staking chain Stride and its DeFi assets. This will allow these Cosmos native assets to be converted into an ERC20 representation to be fully utilized on the Evmos chain in things such as DeFi.

Tokens To Be Registered:

STRD: The native staking and governance token of the Stride chain

stATOM: The Stride liquid staking derivative of the ATOM token

stJUNO: The Stride liquid staking derivative of the JUNO token

stOSMO: The Stride liquid staking derivative of the OSMO token

stSTARS: The Stride liquid staking derivative of the STARS token

Benefits:

Liquid staked assets unlock a large amount of liquidity to be used in DeFi. Having these assets on Evmos will help spark DeFi, improve TVL, and bring in users from multiple ecosystems by enabling exposure to DeFi protocols.

The JSON for the proposal will be made by the guru himself, @GV | Swiss Staking .

Please provide any feedback or concerns if there is anything needs to be addressed before going on chain.

result.title: This%20proposal%20creates%20and%20registers%20an%20ERC-20%20representation%20for%20e-Money%20Euro%20stablecoin%20(EEUR)
result.plaintext:
hello there!

We at Neokingdom DAO will make a proposal next week to register e-Money Euro stablecoin (EEUR) as an ERC-20 token on EVMOS. Once the proposal is approved by the EVMOS governance, the ERC-20 uses a factory pattern to deploy an ERC20 token contract representation of the e-Money Euro coin. More info regarding x/erc20 module [here](https://github.com/evmos/evmos/tree/main/x/erc20/spec).

## Main benefits for doing so

- Users will be able to swap EVMOS with EEUR on EVMOS itself (giving EEUR access to DeFi protocols, NFT).
- Build new applications that are based on ERC-20 smart contracts and have access to the Cosmos ecosystem. (Neokingdom is one of them).
- Give to European users the freedom to use their "native" currency.

**Note: Swiss Staking will help us finalize the JSON proposal**

result.title: Registration of the Following for ERC20 Representation: REGEN, JUNO, STAR, and Axelar Assets
result.plaintext:
**Summary**

In an effort to grow both the Evmos as well as Cosmos ecosystem, we must continually seek to collaborate and welcome IBC friends into the world of EVM on Cosmos. 

The Evmos ERC20 Module (x/erc20) allows the conversion of ERC20 tokens into IBC assets and vice versa. ERC20 representations opens a wide array of potential "EVM-style" DeFi usages to these IBC assets, while introducing native ERC20 tokens into the world of the IBC interoperability. More about the ERC20 module can be read [here](https://medium.com/evmos/introducing-evmos-erc20-module-f40a61e05273). 

**Proposed Tokens for ERC20 Representation**

The list of following tokens were selected by the core team and we would like community feedback before putting these to vote on chain.

- REGEN (https://www.regen.network/) - Regen Network is a community driven DAO with the goals of empowering and incubating initiatives for a greener earth with tokenized carbon credits.

- JUNO (https://www.junonetwork.io/) - Juno is a fellow Cosmos based smart contracting network that utilize CosmWasm for its contracts. EVM/Solidity <> CosmWasm interoperability is something that the whole IBC ecosystem should be excited about!

- STAR (https://www.stargaze.zone/) - STAR is the native token of Stargaze, the undisputed leader in Cosmos' NFT space. With work being done on 721 interoperability, Stargaze is a project we also hope to have a long fruitful relationship with.

- axlUSDC
- axlDAI
- axlWETH
- axlWBTC
- axlDOT (https://polkadot.network/)
- axlMKR  (https://makerdao.com/en/)

Axelar tokens (denoted by the prefix 'axl') are assets that have already been launched by the Axelar Network -- a project that is bringing much more that just bridging to the EVM <> IBC interoperability initiatives. The message transport layer by Axelar will bring cross-chain interoperable "xapps" and the potentials it brings to the table are endless. More about Axelar: https://axelar.network/

**Disclaimer:**

Registering these tokens for ERC20 representation does not necessarily guarantee that there will be any incentive programs or partnerships. However, it is undeniable that all these projects bring great value to the IBC ecosystem, and Evmos would love to collaborate and grow together.

**Execution:**

This proposal will result in 9 (potentially more) on-chain votes. Each ERC20 registration must have its own vote, so please voice any concerns or ideas you may have.

ERC20 representations opens a wide array of potential "EVM-style" DeFi usages to these IBC assets, while introducing native ERC20 tokens into the world of the IBC interoperability. More about the ERC20 module can be read [here](https://medium.com/evmos/introducing-evmos-erc20-module-f40a61e05273). 

**Proposed Tokens for ERC20 Representation **

The list of following tokens were selected by the core team and we would like community feedback before putting these to vote on chain.

- REGEN (https://www.regen.network/) - Regen Network is a community driven DAO with the goals of empowering and incubating initiatives for a greener earth with tokenized carbon credits.

- JUNO (https://www.junonetwork.io/) - Juno is a fellow Cosmos based smart contracting network that utilize CosmWasm for its contracts. EVM/Solidity <> CosmWasm interoperability is something that the whole IBC ecosystem should be excited about!

- STAR (https://www.stargaze.zone/) - STAR is the native token of Stargaze, the undisputed leader in Cosmos' NFT space. With work being done on 721 interoperability, Stargaze is a project we also hope to have a long fruitful relationship with.

- axlUSDC
- axlDAI
- axlWETH
- axlWBTC
- axlDOT (https://polkadot.network/)
- axlMKR  (https://makerdao.com/en/)

Axelar tokens (denoted by the prefix 'axl') are assets that have already been launched by the Axelar Network -- a project that is bringing much more that just bridging to the EVM <> IBC interoperability initiatives. The message transport layer by Axelar will bring cross-chain interoperable "xapps" and the potentials it brings to the table are endless. More about Axelar: https://axelar.network/

**Disclaimer:**

Registering these tokens for ERC20 representation does not necessarily guarantee that there will be any incentive programs or partnerships. However, it is undeniable that all these projects bring great value to the IBC ecosystem, and Evmos would love to collaborate and grow together.

**Execution: **

This proposal will result in 9 (potentially more) on-chain votes. Each ERC20 registration must have its own vote, so please voice any concerns or ideas you may have.
"}

topic.name: 4. ERC-20 Module
topic.description: Governance Proposal to whitelist assets on the erc20 module which converts ICS20 <-> ERC20 tokens

result.title: This proposal creates and registers an ERC20 representation for Cosmos (ATOM)
result.plaintext:
Hey Hey Hey!

Swiss Staking will make a proposal next week to register Cosmos (ATOM) as an Erc20-Token on Evmos. Once the proposal passes (i.e is Approved by governance), the ERC20 module uses a factory pattern to deploy an ERC20 token contract representation of the Cosmos (ATOM) Coin. More info regarding x/erc20 module [here](https://github.com/evmos/evmos/tree/main/x/erc20/spec)

**3 main benefits for doing so:**
1. users will be able to swap Evmos with ATOM on Evmos itself (giving ATOM access to DeFi protocols, NFT)
2. build new applications that are based on ERC-20 smart contracts and have access to the Cosmos ecosystem.
3. AAVE will be deployed on Evmos and ATOM is an initial supported asset [more here](https://governance.aave.com/t/deploy-aave-v3-on-evmos/7149)


**Recap**
- We are primarily guided by the following naming convention [assetlist](https://github.com/osmosis-labs/assetlists/blob/main/osmosis-1/osmosis-1.assetlist.json#L50-L65)
- We shouldn't specify a channel number to the symbol ```
{NAME}
``` on the first coin registration. E.g. whatever is picked as the canonical channel should be symbol ```
{NAME}
``` and if a secondary representation of that IBC token is registered in the evm then a suffix to the symbol ```
{NAME}-{channel-number}
``` should be added. I'll make a PR on Github to update it


**JSON that I'll submit. Please double check:**
 
- naming convention 
- ibc denom (from channel-292 to channel-3)


```
{
  "description": "The native staking and governance token of the Cosmos Hub.",
   "denom_units": [
                {
                        "denom": "ibc/A4DB47A9D3CF9A068D454513891B526702455D3EF08FB9EB558C561F9DC2B701",
                        "exponent": 0,
                        "aliases": ["uatom"]
                },
                {
                        "denom": "atom",
                        "exponent": 6
                }

        ],
        "base": "ibc/A4DB47A9D3CF9A068D454513891B526702455D3EF08FB9EB558C561F9DC2B701",
        "display": "atom",
        "name": "Cosmos Hub",
        "symbol": "ATOM"
}

```

EDIT: 
changing: 
```
"name": "Cosmos" to  
"name": "Cosmos Hub"
```

topic.name: 4. ERC-20 Module
topic.description: Governance Proposal to whitelist assets on the erc20 module which converts ICS20 <-> ERC20 tokens

result.title: (Testnet) RegisterERC20 -- Register Nomad USDC and wETH (madUSDC, madwETH) for conversion to ICS20
result.plaintext:
# RegisterERC20 Proposal: USDC, wETH (Testnet)

**Author:**

Conner Swann ([@yourbuddyconner](https://twitter.com/yourbuddyconner)), Nomad Core Team

  

**Context:**

The Nomad Team would like to start a discussion about the merits of whitelisting Nomad Assets for conversion to Native Cosmos coins. This proposal thread corresponds to two on-chain Testnet proposals: 

- RegisterERC20 (Goerli USDC): https://testnet.mintscan.io/evmos-testnet/proposals/31
- RegisterERC20 (Goerli wETH): #TODO

**About Nomad:**

[**Nomad**](https://nomad.xyz) is building interoperability solutions for the cross-chain future. Leveraging an optimistic mechanism, the **Nomad Core** protocol facilitates message-passing between sovereign blockchains, and requires only one honest actor to prevent fraud. Using this technology, the **Nomad Bridge** allows users to transfer ERC-20 tokens between blockchains, such as _Ethereum_ and _Evmos_.

  

As the canonical bridge between EVM chains and Evmos, Nomad Tokens will receive liquidity incentives once the governance process has enabled them.

  

**The Evmos ERC-20 Module:**

> The recent Evmos[v0.4](https://github.com/tharsis/evmos/releases/tag/v0.4.2)upgrade includes support for the ERC-20 module (aka x/erc20). The module allows users to instantly convert ERC-20 tokens into native Cosmos Coins and vice versa. This will allow users to exchange assets interchangeably in two entirely different layers, the EVM and Cosmos.  
>   
> Read More about [the ERC-20 Module](https://evmos.blog/introducing-evmos-erc20-module-f40a61e05273) on the Evmos Blog

  

**This Proposal:**

If successful, this Testnet `RegisterERC20` proposal will allow users to convert their ERC-20 balance from Nomad testnet Goerli USDC and Goerli wETH (also known as madUSDC and madgwETH respectively) to a Native Cosmos Coin via the _ERC-20 Module_ which can be transferred in turn to IBC-connected domains like the Cosmos Hub Testnet or Osmosis Testnet.

  

* * *

  

madUSDC is a Nomad representation of the canonical testnet deployment of USDC on the Goerli Testnet, the native tokens have been locked in the Nomad `BridgeRouter` [contract](https://goerli.etherscan.io//address/0x6d8acf60f3ddb6c49def2a2b77e56be2ff1502cf) on Goerli and representation tokens are minted on Evmos Testnet.

  

Note: USDC has 6 decimal places which is non-standard, making it an ideal candidate to test tooling and ensure block explorers represent balances correctly.

  

USDC Contracts:

*   Origin USDC on Goerli: [0x07865c6e87b9f70255377e024ace6630c1eaa37f](https://goerli.etherscan.io/address/0x07865c6e87b9f70255377e024ace6630c1eaa37f)
*   USDC on Evmos Testnet (aka madUSDC): [0xD2bF8E3aF44465d26aED67414e2E65c34c66c23f](https://evm.evmos.dev/address/0xD2bF8E3aF44465d26aED67414e2E65c34c66c23f/contracts)

  

* * *

  

gwETH (aka madgwETH) is a Nomad representation of native wETH on the Goerli Testnet, the native tokens have been locked in the Nomad `BridgeRouter` [contract](https://goerli.etherscan.io//address/0x6d8acf60f3ddb6c49def2a2b77e56be2ff1502cf) on Goerli and representation tokens are minted on Evmos Testnet.

  

Note: gwETH has 18 decimal places, making it a good complement to USDC for testing the `erc20` module end-to-end.

  

wETH Contracts:

*   Origin wETH on Goerli: [0x0bb7509324ce409f7bbc4b701f932eaca9736ab7](https://goerli.etherscan.io/address/0x0bb7509324ce409f7bbc4b701f932eaca9736ab7)
*   wETH on Evmos (aka madgwETH): [0x474ab53c7DFf472B542DD3206556B9F00a09FE3e](https://evm.evmos.dev/address/0x474ab53c7DFf472B542DD3206556B9F00a09FE3e/transactions)

  

* * *

  

**Testing this Proposal:**

Please test this functionality! There's several operations one can do to flex the `erc20` module.

  

*   Get USDC on Goerli with the [USDC Faucet](https://usdcfaucet.com/) and gETH with the [Paradigm MultiFaucet](https://faucet.paradigm.xyz/)
*   Bridge your USDC with the [Nomad Staging UI](https://staging.app.nomad.xyz/) to Evmos Testnet
*   Convert your USDC / gWETH with `evmosd tx erc20 convert-erc20`
*   Send it to Osmosis Testnet with `evmosd tx ibc-transfer transfer`
*   Check your balance with [Ping.pub Testnet Explorer](https://testnet.ping.pub/osmosis)
*   Get tOSMO from the [Faucet Channel on Discord](https://docs.osmosis.zone/validators/validating-testnet.html#create-validator-command)
*   Send it back to Evmos Testnet with `osmosisd tx ibc-transfer transfer`

  

**Useful Commands:**

  

_Convert 10 madUSDC_

```plain
evmosd tx erc20 convert-erc20 0x474ab53c7DFf472B542DD3206556B9F00a09FE3e 10000000 \
--from mykey \
--fees=80atevmos --gas=auto -b block \
--node="https://tendermint.bd.evmos.dev:26657"
```

  

_Convert 10 gwETH_

```plain
evmosd tx erc20 convert-erc20 0xD2bF8E3aF44465d26aED67414e2E65c34c66c23f 10000000000000000000 \
--from mykey \
--fees=80atevmos --gas=auto -b block \
--node="https://tendermint.bd.evmos.dev:26657"
```

  

_Send 10 madUSDC Coin to Osmosis Testnet:_

```plain
evmosd tx ibc-transfer transfer transfer channel-7 \
<receiver_osmosis_address> 10000000erc20/0x474ab53c7DFf472B542DD3206556B9F00a09FE3e \
--fees 80atevmos --from mykey \
 --node="https://tendermint.bd.evmos.dev:26657" 
```

  

Send 10 gwETH Coin to Osmosis Testnet:

```plain
evmosd tx ibc-transfer transfer transfer channel-7 \
<receiver_osmosis_address> 10000000000000000000erc20/0xD2bF8E3aF44465d26aED67414e2E65c34c66c23f \
--fees 80atevmos --from mykey \
 --node="https://tendermint.bd.evmos.dev:26657" 
```

result.title: This proposal creates and registers an ERC20 representation for Osmosis
result.plaintext:
Hello Evmosians!

Swiss Staking will make a proposal next week to register Osmosis as an Erc20-Token on Evmos. Once the proposal passes (i.e is Approved by governance), the ERC20 module uses a factory pattern to deploy an ERC20 token contract representation of the Osmosis Coin.

Two main benefits for doing so:

- Users will be able to buy Evmos with Osmosis (assuming it will be listed on Diffusion/Cronus)

- ERC-20 smart contracts can have access to the Osmosis ecosystem.

More info regarding x/erc20 module here

**JSON submission - feel free to review. **

result.title: Register Nomad representations of the following ERC20 tokens: wBTC , DAI, USDT, FRAX, FXS for the ERC20 module
result.plaintext:
The ERC20 module is now enabled and I'd like to start discussion to submit Nomad Bridge representation of the ERC20 tokens wBTC , DAI, USDT, FRAX, FXS to be convertible to an ICS20 token via the ERC20 Module.

Right now Nomad's ERC20 token representations are having a high share of the volume and TVL on the Evmos EVM and converting them to ICS20 tokens will solidify the IBC connection of Evmos with other Cosmos chains and help bring EVM users to Cosmos and more Cosmos users to the EVM.

result.title: Register%20Gravity%20Bridge%20ERC20's%20(Props%2015%20-%2020)
result.plaintext:
Up for discussion are props 15 - 20, which seek to register the ERC20 versions of Gravity Bridge assets.

Prop 15 - Register GRAV

Prop 16 - Register G-DAI

Prop 17 - Register G-USDC

Prop 18 - Register G-USDT

Prop 19 - Register G-WBTC

Prop 20 - Register G-WETH

These proposals have been put up for voting and have already been funded and it's my understanding that these props have already been through testnet.

I believe these proposals are necessary to start using Gravity Bridged assets on Diffusion and Kinesis and the teams have been in communication with each other.

More info here:

https://discord.com/channels/809048090249134080/913597332073898034/976678633190096977

result.title: Faucet for DeFi Kickoff
result.plaintext:
Hey! 

The Diffusion incentives will start soon. As you might know, some incentivized pools require to bridge assets from Ethereum via Axelar/Gravity to Evmos. Once they are bridged to Evmos, you must convert them (on the asset page of Evmos) from IBC-coins to ERC-20 tokens. This requires a fee of about ~0.3 Evmos. New ecosystem participants won't own any Evmos at this time, so it is crucial to implement a faucet which funds them. This situation is only temporary, as the team will implement an auto-converseion on protocol level in the near future. Until then, it's our job to onboard new participants with ease to unleash the full potential of the DeFi revival on Evmos. 

As a first attempt we'll implement the faucet on Discord and expand it, if needed, in a separate web app. We'll implement features to avoid any gaming of the faucet with the support of the Orbital Apes team. 

Onboarding 20,000 users is a likely scenario thus we ask for 6,000 Evmos to be used for dust. Unused Evmos will be returned within 6 months. 

Let me know what you think about it

result.title: Temperature Check - Cosmos L1 Token Swaps
result.plaintext:
Evmos is in need of liquidity. An idea thats been floating around is L1-L1 token swaps. Id like to get the discussion rolling on swaps with other Cosmos chains, such as ATOM, Juno, Injective, and Osmosis.

Edit To clarify, these would be direct OTC trades with other treasuries. The swap would not be on the open market; it would not be a huge sell pressure for Evmos.

This would be a first step in introducing EVM native users to the greater Cosmos ecosystem we are a part of.

Strong LPs with little slippage can be seeded by the Evmos DAO. This will also help establish good interchain diplomacy, making us all stronger by these unions.

What is a token swap?

The Evmos DAO would swap EVMOS from the Community Pool for a USD equivalent amount of another Layer 1's tokens. Diversifying our treasury while building working relationships with other Cosmos Chains.

How can it benefit Evmos?

For example the Evmos DAO executes a $500,000 USD equivalent swap of Evmos for Juno. The Juno now held in the Community's treasury is then paired with an equal amount of EVMOS which is added to a Liquidity Pool, providing $1 million of deep liquidity, low slippage access to Juno on the Evmos chain.

While on the Juno chain the same actions occur; this gives Juno users a way to directly access Evmos (avoiding intermediary chains).

In this example, by swapping $500,000 of tokens we create $1 million worth of liquidity on each chain.

What are your thoughts on creating a Token Swap Program?

What other ways could this benefit Evmos?

result.title: [Evmos] Recover IBC tokens from Airdrop
result.plaintext:
# Community Pool Spend: Recover IBC tokens from Airdrop

## Author

Daniel Burckhardt ([@danburck](https://twitter.com/danburck)), Evmos Core Team

## Motivation

Evmos [Rektdrop](https://medium.com/evmos/the-evmos-rektdrop-abbe931ba823) pioneered a new model for distributing tokens. As announced on the [Evmos dashboard](https://app.evmos.org/mission-control), the Rektdrop ended on Block [5074187](https://www.mintscan.io/evmos/blocks/5074187) (30 September 2022 at 16:06:40 UTC) and clawed back of all unclaimed tokens, returning them to the Evmos Community Pool.

During this process, the [IBC module account](https://www.mintscan.io/evmos/account/evmos1a53udazy8ayufvy0s434pfwjcedzqv345dnt3x) was falsely targeted for clawback and transferred all EVMOS tokens from the IBC module account to the Evmos Community Pool. At the time of the clawback, this account held a balance of ~3.2 million EVMOS tokens (3167501226339726493675414aevmos). 

To remediate this unexpected transfer of funds, we propose to return the funds from the Evmos Community Pool back to the IBC module account with this proposal. Note that we are simply withdrawing the amount from the Community Pool that could affect users and not the entire amount in the Community Pool.

## Impact

The EVMOS tokens on the IBC module account represent the total amount of EVMOS tokens that have been sent to other chains over IBC. Users may currently be encountering an inability to transfer their EVMOS balances on these other chains back to Evmos. This is because there is an insufficient balance on the IBC module account. The Community Pool Spend outlined in this proposal would restore the balance on the IBC module account, enabling users to once again transfer up to their entire balance of EVMOS tokens from other Comsmos chains back to the Evmos chain via IBC.

The bug also falsely targeted some additional user accounts during the clawback. This means that some users' funds were accidentally clawed back to the Community Pool as well. Weve moved quickly to identify the wallets affected and amounts that each are owed. We are currently planning an additional upgrade that returns these funds as well. 

## Requested amount

The requested amount to be returned to the IBC module account is determined by comparing the account balance one block before the clawback and after the block after the clawback.

Before clawback:

```bash
evmos@evmostest:~/evmos8.2.0/bin$ ./evmosd q bank balances evmos1a53udazy8ayufvy0s434pfwjcedzqv345dnt3x --height 5074186
balances:
- amount: "3167501226339726493675414"
  denom: aevmos
- amount: "100"
  denom: ibc/25813B5DF7C0AF9FB79A71EF8E67FE4E182A03BB4145D248DADFAF74006835B2
- amount: "11000"
  denom: ibc/5CC0E9B98B8C719E3378F941B40A4FAC9F750A155F3788E4C449144C08EA4537
- amount: "12274000"
  denom: ibc/693989F95CF3279ADC113A6EF21B02A51EC054C95A9083F2E290126668149433
- amount: "12000000000000000"
  denom: ibc/6B3FCE336C3465D3B72F7EFB4EB92FC521BC480FE9653F627A0BD0237DF213F3
- amount: "1000000"
  denom: ibc/7F0C2CB6E79CC36D29DA7592899F98E3BEFD2CF77A94340C317032A78812393D
- amount: "2310000"
  denom: ibc/A4DB47A9D3CF9A068D454513891B526702455D3EF08FB9EB558C561F9DC2B701
- amount: "100000000000000000"
  denom: ibc/D8921A62D207159A25FFEA0DB4E7DB623A095219B60D99768CCE9D3DF66122C7
pagination:
  next_key: null
  total: "0"
```

After clawback: 

```bash
evmos@evmostest:~/evmos8.2.0/bin$ ./evmosd q bank balances evmos1a53udazy8ayufvy0s434pfwjcedzqv345dnt3x --height 5074187
balances:
- amount: "100"
  denom: ibc/25813B5DF7C0AF9FB79A71EF8E67FE4E182A03BB4145D248DADFAF74006835B2
- amount: "11000"
  denom: ibc/5CC0E9B98B8C719E3378F941B40A4FAC9F750A155F3788E4C449144C08EA4537
- amount: "12274000"
  denom: ibc/693989F95CF3279ADC113A6EF21B02A51EC054C95A9083F2E290126668149433
- amount: "12000000000000000"
  denom: ibc/6B3FCE336C3465D3B72F7EFB4EB92FC521BC480FE9653F627A0BD0237DF213F3
- amount: "1000000"
  denom: ibc/7F0C2CB6E79CC36D29DA7592899F98E3BEFD2CF77A94340C317032A78812393D
- amount: "2310000"
  denom: ibc/A4DB47A9D3CF9A068D454513891B526702455D3EF08FB9EB558C561F9DC2B701
- amount: "100000000000000000"
  denom: ibc/D8921A62D207159A25FFEA0DB4E7DB623A095219B60D99768CCE9D3DF66122C7
pagination:
  next_key: null
  total: "0"
```

The entire EVMOS balance of 3167501226339726493675414aevmos was transferred to the community pool after the clawback. 

## Learnings

The Evmos team will publish a detailed post-mortem document to reflect on what led to this event and how it could have been prevented. These reflections have helped us to improve our team's testing processes a lot in the past and build resilient software. We apologize for any inconvenience that this might have caused and are open to any further questions on this topic.

result.title: Incubation Proposal from ChainHub
result.plaintext:
###
# INCUBATION PROPOSAL

**Sriram Vishwanath (Professor, University of Texas Austin)**

**ChainHub & Texas Blockchain Incubator**

**sriram@chainhub.net**

#### INTRODUCTION

This proposal details an incubation partnership agreement between ChainHub (the incubation arm of Texas Blockchain) and The Evmos Community. ChainHub is an incubator, currently based in Austin TX (which is expanding to other cities in the USA in coming months) focused on University students and College Blockchain clubs. ChainHub actively incubates projects from The University of Texas, Austin and the surrounding Austin community and, post-expansion, will be incubating projects from Carnegie Mellon University as well as other Universities/Colleges within the USA.

ChainHub is managed by Sriram Vishwanath. Sriram is a Professor of Engineering at The University of Texas, Austin. He has a PhD from Stanford, an MS from Caltech and a BTech from IIT Madras. He is the faculty sponsor and founding faculty advisor of Texas Blockchain ([https://www.texasblockchain.org/](https://www.texasblockchain.org/)) and he teaches the engineering and software centric blockchain classes on University of Texas Austin campus.

Linkedin Profile: [https://www.linkedin.com/in/sriramvishwanath/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sriramvishwanath/)

#### OUR EXPERIENCE

Texas Blockchain has been working on projects within the blockchain/crypto domain for roughly 5 years, and ChainHub is its incubation arm. We currently incubate projects within two other ecosystems: Polkadot and NEAR, and we have similar agreements in place with each of the ecosystems. Some of the incubated projects include: Quai Network [https://quai.network/](https://quai.network/), Zyfty [https://zyfty.io/#/](https://zyfty.io/#/), Mirror World [https://www.mirrormy.world/](https://www.mirrormy.world/) and a few other projects still in stealth.

ChainHub proposes to work with Evmos to incubate approximately
# 1
 two projects a year, on a calendar year basis, tailored to Evmos's priorities and needs. To this end, we will work closely with Evmos to converge on two or more projects and bring together a highly capable team to deliver on each project. These teams will be mentored, managed and funded by ChainHub through a grant provided by Evmos (see budget request below).

#### SUMMARY OF TERMS

1. ChainHub will:
  1. Incubate approximately two projects per year, starting with September 2022. These projects will be selected in close coordination with the Evmos team.
  2. Support these projects from their inception to minimum viable product (MVP) completion. We will staff each project with a talented and passionate team of students/alumni from the Universities/Colleges with which we are co-located.
2. Evmos will:

1. The Evmos Foundation will work closely with ChainHub to identify projects and mentor each project team.
2. The Evmos Community ChainHub (see budget request below) will provide resources necessary towards execution.
3. The Evmos Foundation will partner with each project team: help with pitch-deck/fundraising, product roadmap and long term strategic growth of each entity resulting from this incubation process.

With the exception of 2022, ChainHub will submit a new proposal in Q1 of each calendar year for the Evmos Community's consideration for renewal of this engagement for that calendar year.

#### BUDGET REQUEST

As tokens are volatile and ChainHub/Texas Blockchain will bear all the costs of development of the project, we request $1M in tokens per calendar year for the duration of this incubation agreement. This will cover the costs of project incubation (including developers, designers, audits, incubation space and operational support for each project).

We request the tokens be provided as follows:

1. The first 50% at kickoff with Evmos (285714 Evmos equivalent to $0.5M)
2. The next 25% when the first project is determined to be completed by Evmos Foundation (142857 Evmos equivalent to $0.25M)
3. The final 25% when the second project is determined to be completed by Evmos Foundation (142857 Evmos equivalent to $0.25M)

A breakdown of costs across the two projects are (these are rough order of magnitude):

1. Engineering Team/Developers/Product Lead - 625K
2. Full time Designer (for both projects) - 75K
3. Incubation space - 100K (covers space rent, utilities, laptops, monitors, all infrastructure including 6 servers)
4. Audits - 125K (for the entire platform(s) including full stack software, not just the smart contracts)
5. Operational Staff (payroll/HR/health insurance/misc software) - 75K

Each engineering team/devs/product lead will comprise of: approximately 2 Web3 + backend engineers, 1 part-time or full time front-end engineers, and 1 product lead.

The tokens will be staked and existing incubator resources will be used until those resources are exhausted. When exhausted, we will primarily aim to use OTC services to convert tokens to USD. When OTC services are unavailable or limited, we will use other means of conversion to USD. If OTC services are unavailable, we will limit ourselves to at most 50K a month in conversion to USD.

A multisig will be set up to manage this schedule by members of the community. When the Evmos Foundation marks a particular project's MVP as complete, the associated tranche of tokens will be released to ChainHub.

#### PROPOSED PROJECTS

 **EvLend**

Project Specs: [https://sierra-fi.gitbook.io/evlend/](https://sierra-fi.gitbook.io/evlend/)

EvLend aims to be the most efficient variable rate borrow-lend market on Evmos.

EvLend uses reactive interest rate technology to target specific utilization rates (% of funds in the money market being borrowed) for stablecoin assets while still providing support for borrow & lend services to other assets.

Reactive interest rates are a more recent innovation popularized by Euler finance. EvLend takes the power of this concept and maximizes it for stablecoin markets.

EvLend can demonstrate a standard model by which maximum efficiency of interest rates may be reached. Building such a system can lead to economies of scale and majority share of lending volume for a given core stablecoin.

More information on reactive rates, our stablecoin focus, and project development timeline can be found in the GitBook specs link above.

**Evmos Bridge**

Project Specs: [https://crest-protocol.gitbook.io/evmos-bridge-specs/](https://crest-protocol.gitbook.io/evmos-bridge-specs/)

We propose a bridge tailored to maximize the ease of onboarding into the Evmos ecosystem. Our solution focuses on supporting the most bridge paths into and out of Evmos as well as focusing on user education to increase usage within the Evmos and broader Cosmos ecosystem.

The proposed bridge will consist of a liquidity network architecture utilizing native assets and thus no minting and burning. Additionally, we will build the cross-chain protocol leveraging a battle tested security and consensus model that is as secure as the economic security of the blockchains it is built upon.

With the minimal bridge paths available today, Evmos will continue to struggle with onboarding users and value into the ecosystem.

Providing routes for users to bridge from the most popular DeFi hubs such as Optimism, Polygon, Arbitrum, Avalanche, among others, streamlines the process for users to onboard value into Evmos by orders of magnitude.

For more information regarding the specifications of the bridge please refer to the documentation or reach back out to us for any further questions.

[1](#sdfootnote1anc) We say "approximate" as we may not converge on two projects, or may converge on more than two per year. Our goal will remain to incubate at least two per year.

Some of the incubated projects include: Quai Network [https://quai.network/](https://quai.network/), Zyfty [https://zyfty.io/#/](https://zyfty.io/#/), Mirror World [https://www.mirrormy.world/](https://www.mirrormy.world/) and a few other projects still in stealth.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"ChainHub proposes to work with Evmos to incubate approximately\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"# 1\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\" two projects a year, on a calendar year basis, tailored to Evmos's priorities and needs. These teams will be mentored, managed and funded by ChainHub through a grant provided by Evmos (see budget request below).\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"#### SUMMARY OF TERMS\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"1. ChainHub will:\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"  1. Incubate approximately two projects per year, starting with September 2022. These projects will be selected in close coordination with the Evmos team.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"  2. Support these projects from their inception to minimum viable product (MVP) completion. We will staff each project with a talented and passionate team of students/alumni from the Universities/Colleges with which we are co-located.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"2. Evmos will:\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"1. The Evmos Foundation will work closely with ChainHub to identify projects and mentor each project team.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"2. The Evmos Community ChainHub (see budget request below) will provide resources necessary towards execution.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"3. The Evmos Foundation will partner with each project team: help with pitch-deck/fundraising, product roadmap and long term strategic growth of each entity resulting from this incubation process.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"With the exception of 2022, ChainHub will submit a new proposal in Q1 of each calendar year for the Evmos Community's consideration for renewal of this engagement for that calendar year.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"#### BUDGET REQUEST\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"As tokens are volatile and ChainHub/Texas Blockchain will bear all the costs of development of the project, we request $1M in tokens per calendar year for the duration of this incubation agreement. This will cover the costs of project incubation (including developers, designers, audits, incubation space and operational support for each project).\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"We request the tokens be provided as follows:\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"1. The first 50% at kickoff with Evmos (285714 Evmos equivalent to $0.5M)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"2. The next 25% when the first project is determined to be completed by Evmos Foundation (142857 Evmos equivalent to $0.25M)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"3. The final 25% when the second project is determined to be completed by Evmos Foundation (142857 Evmos equivalent to $0.25M)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"A breakdown of costs across the two projects are (these are rough order of magnitude):\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"1. Engineering Team/Developers/Product Lead - 625K\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"2. Full time Designer (for both projects) - 75K\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"3. Incubation space - 100K (covers space rent, utilities, laptops, monitors, all infrastructure including 6 servers)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"4. Audits - 125K (for the entire platform(s) including full stack software, not just the smart contracts)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"5. Operational Staff (payroll/HR/health insurance/misc software) - 75K\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Each engineering team/devs/product lead will comprise of: approximately 2 Web3 + backend engineers, 1 part-time or full time front-end engineers, and 1 product lead.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"The tokens will be staked and existing incubator resources will be used until those resources are exhausted. When exhausted, we will primarily aim to use OTC services to convert tokens to USD. When OTC services are unavailable or limited, we will use other means of conversion to USD. If OTC services are unavailable, we will limit ourselves to at most 50K a month in conversion to USD.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"A multisig will be set up to manage this schedule by members of the community. When the Evmos Foundation marks a particular project's MVP as complete, the associated tranche of tokens will be released to ChainHub.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"#### PROPOSED PROJECTS\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"1. **EvLend**\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Project Specs: [https://sierra-fi.gitbook.io/evlend/](https://sierra-fi.gitbook.io/evlend/)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"EvLend aims to be the most efficient variable rate borrow-lend market on Evmos.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"EvLend uses reactive interest rate technology to target specific utilization rates (% of funds in the money market being borrowed) for stablecoin assets while still providing support for borrow & lend services to other assets.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Reactive interest rates are a more recent innovation popularized by Euler finance. EvLend takes the power of this concept and maximizes it for stablecoin markets.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"EvLend can demonstrate a standard model by which maximum efficiency of interest rates may be reached. Building such a system can lead to economies of scale and majority share of lending volume for a given core stablecoin.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"More information on reactive rates, our stablecoin focus, and project development timeline can be found in the GitBook specs link above.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"1. **Evmos Bridge**\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Project Specs: [https://crest-protocol.gitbook.io/evmos-bridge-specs/](https://crest-protocol.gitbook.io/evmos-bridge-specs/)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"We propose a bridge tailored to maximize the ease of onboarding into the Evmos ecosystem. Our solution focuses on supporting the most bridge paths into and out of Evmos as well as focusing on user education to increase usage within the Evmos and broader Cosmos ecosystem.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"The proposed bridge will consist of a liquidity network architecture utilizing native assets and thus no minting and burning. Additionally, we will build the cross-chain protocol leveraging a battle tested security and consensus model that is as secure as the economic security of the blockchains it is built upon.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"With the minimal bridge paths available today, Evmos will continue to struggle with onboarding users and value into the ecosystem.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Providing routes for users to bridge from the most popular DeFi hubs such as Optimism, Polygon, Arbitrum, Avalanche, among others, streamlines the process for users to onboard value into Evmos by orders of magnitude.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"For more information regarding the specifications of the bridge please refer to the documentation or reach back out to us for any further questions.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"[1](#sdfootnote1anc) We say \\\"approximate\\\" as we may not converge on two projects, or may converge on more than two per year. Our goal will remain to incubate at least two per year.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"}]}"}

result.title: Temperature Check - Extending Osmosis External Incentives
result.plaintext:
Hi all,

This is a follow up to Proposal 39 to introduce Evmos external incentives in Osmosis, Pool 722 (EVMOS/OSMO) . The original Commonwealth discussion can be found HERE .

Background

We have had great success with incentivizing the EVMOS/OSMO pool on Osmosis through Prop 39 and providing 600,000 EVMOS tokens for external incentives over 90 days. Since then, EVMOS has become one of the most popular pools on Osmosis through TVL, volume, and daily APRs. At the time of writing, the pool has grown from just $2M, now to the 6th largest pool on osmosis with a TVL of $7.3M (Peaking at $10M) and 3rd highest 7-day volume of $6.5M. The number of tokens locked in the LP have grown from 700k EVMOS before the incentives started to now just over 2M! The incentives that helped drive this success will be expiring on October 18th , so the community needs to decide the next steps forward!

(image)

Questions

#1) Does the community wish to extend the Osmosis External Incentives?

#2) If so, how many tokens? For how many days?

Proposal

UPDATE OCT 4th 2022

Based on poll results and community feedback in Discord and Commonwealth, seems like the preferred path forward is another 600k EVMOS over 90 days . Osmosis is the gateway for new users into the Cosmos ecosystem so it is important to maintain deep liquidity. Once this period is over, we can reevaluate the incentives as we will have a clearer picture with how native liquidity has grown.

600k EVMOS over a 90 day period (6,666.67 EVMOS per day), 100 EVMOS for funding Osmosis gauge creation and filling. (Updated Oct. 8th)

TOTAL : 600,100 EVMOS

14 day bond only

Pool 722 (EVMOS/OSMO)

MULTISIG (3/4)

0xbAFE2Ae09c621462032BbC7FC997aA89c9780639

bennylava - Evmos Community Manager/Evmos Governance Workstream

@Tricky | Cosmos Spaces - Evmos Governance Workstream

LPX - Evmos Governance Workstream

JohnnyWyles - Osmosis Labs

Timeline

A proposal would need to be on-chain no later than October 10th and subsequently passed to allow for enough time to refill the gauge and have no disruption in external incentive rewards.

-benny

result.title: Blockchain%20Classification%20System%20%5BBCS%5D%20for%20Research%20Topics
result.plaintext:
## Blockchain Classification System [BCS]

Our chain owes its very existence to previous research and implementation:

- Bitcoin
- Ethereum
- Cosmos SDK
- Ethermint

Even presently: most research is done by a handful of projects (See [ETH Research](https://ethresear.ch/)), and most other communities and derived chains benefit as freeloaders.

This situation is not morally acceptable. We should and we want to give back resources and a direction for research.

We suggest the creation of a classification system for the domain of knowledge of blockchain that is intuitive, simple to navigate, and able to attract resources and support for further research.

### Method

Given the root concept of "Blockchain Research", construct a SKOS graph (as free of internal loops as possible) that will have the research papers as nodes.

The system should be in version 1:

1. decentralized
2. searchable
3. data dump downloadable
4. linking at least to the most important papers

We should seek to also provide for the next versions:

- incentivized peer review
- incentivized maintenance

### Resources

We may find the following resources useful:

- [Computing Classification System](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SubjectRaw/SubjectRaw/gh-pages/subject/data/eng/computing.md) in MD format
- [Computing Classification System](https://dl.acm.org/pb-assets/dl_ccs/acm_ccs2012-1626988337597.xml) in XML SKOS format
- [An initial map of the blockchain knowledge](https://github.com/the-laurel/governance/blob/main/docs/StrategicLandscape.md)

### Start

Since the normal placement of blockchain tech is usually:

- everything knowable
...
  - Mathematics
    - Applied Mathematics
      - Computer Science
      ...
        - Decentralized Systems
          - Decentralized Ledger
            - Blockchain Technologies

But Blockchain tech has obvious relationships with governance, ethics, Economics, etc. So, when we put it at the root level, the immediate next level will have to be the linked Sciences (including Computer Science)

- Blockchain Technologies
  - Mathematics
  - Computer Science (deepest and most populated tree expected under this node)
  - Philosophy, Ethics
  - Economics
  - Sociology

Each of these domains of knowledge has its own classification graph. If that graph has a node related to Blockchain, that node has to be presented in the BCS.

### Implementation

As in any SKOS system, we can opt for a flexible RDF triples database for information persistence that is further linked with the official classifications graphs (such as those referred to in the previous section) in such a way that the web2 and/or web3 navigation can access the actual research papers that are hosted on sites like https://arxiv.org/
That means a full-text search for the (labels of the) nodes in the database.

### Funding Items

Those are in the ascending order of expected value:
- hosting a database with good indexing for full-text search: maybe a distributed PostgreSQL-like
- hosting 2 websites (one for the research graph and one for discussions)
- creating the site for discussions with the academic interest of Evmos, Ethermint, and Cosmos SDK as core (same model as https://ethereum-magicians.org/. maybe using the same [tech](https://github.com/discourse/discourse))
- creating a web service that is able to add, modify, search, dump data, interface with https://arxiv.org/, maybe even with Semantic Web
- expertise in data creation:
  - additions/modifications to the RDF graph (knowledge domain linking with already-accepted terminologies and classifications)
  - motivation for peer review entries of new research
  - linking each paper also to public discussions
  - proposing papers for blockchain developers and communities for implementation or financial support

### Management

To start this project, Christian Tzurcanu (the author of this proposal), will work as a volunteer tasked from The Laurel Project in the interest and for the honor and fame of the Evmos Community. He will maintain the transparency of accounting on [this GitHub page](BCS_Accounting.md).
Therefore, the management will be free of payment and with provable results.

### Discussion

This discussion will not be included on-chain, but will be referenced in the on-chain text. It has these main directions: 

- improvements to the proposal text to arrive at its final (on-chain) form
- price discovery of the first useable version
- the initial list of domain experts or teams willing to participate in this first version
- additional ideas, improvements of the end product

result.title: [Pre-Vote] Proposal for Axelar Network, Celer Network, and Gravity Bridge Liquidity Mining
result.plaintext:
Proposal - Start Liquidity Mining Campaign for Gravity, Celer, and Axelar assets

This proposal has been posted to IPFS with the hash: QmXKzWgYjB9hhNpC5CTqdfRAXBg4e7ddPEdaBXDc7iE13v

Hi Evmos Community!

The goal of this proposal is to bring stablecoin liquidity back to Evmos. In the past, Kinesis Labs has reached over 459k USD worth of stablecoins in TVL without any incentives, with over 11,000 transactions and 400 unique liquidity providers. All of this was organic liquidity from the Evmos community, there were no funds or deals done to bootstrap this liquidity.

However, with the recent nomad hack, both Kinesis and Evmos need a way to bootstrap liquidity to jump start the Evmos DeFi ecosystem. Stablecoin liquidity is important to any ecosystem for a few reasons. Firstly, we want to keep value on Evmos. If there is no native stablecoin on Evmos, users wishing to store their value in a stable unit of account will need to bridge back to a chain with stablecoins, thus draining liquidity from the Evmos Ecosystem. Secondly, native deep stablecoin liquidity is important in allowing new stablecoins to grow in Evmos. This has been the main use case of Curve on Ethereum, allowing stablecoins such as DAI, FRAX, and Synthetix USD to remain pegged to the USD dollar. By increasing the amount of stablecoin liquidity new stablecoins can trade against, these new stablecoins get a more robust peg.

We propose the following plan to bring stablecoin liquidity back to Evmos:

50k Evmos tokens to be distributed to the Axelar USDC, Celer USDC, Gravity USDC pool

30k Evmos tokens to be distributed to the Axelar USDT, Celer USDT, Gravity USDT pool

19k Evmos tokens to be distributed to the Axelar DAI, Celer DAI, Gravity DAI pool

We are requesting a total of 99k Evmos for this proposal to be linearly distributed over 2 months. Please note that this is different from the temperature pool composition. We have heard your feedback and sacrificed a bit of security for better user experience.

All of these funds will be distributed to liquidity providers on Kinesis through the minichef contract, no funds will ever reach an EOA or multisig - these funds are not for the Kinesis Team nor the Axelar, Celer, or Gravity teams. Additionally, the only fee on Kinesis is the 0.04% swap fee which goes entirely to LPs, and Kinesis does not currently have a token or any other value extraction mechanism. We are building this project as members of the Evmos ecosystem as a public good. The way we are monetizing is by raising the price of Evmos that we are staking.

The multisig that controls these funds will be a 4 out of 6 consisting of:
Tricky, Cosmos Spaces
LPX, EvmosDAO
Tlopplot, Evmos DAO
Mo Dong, Co-Founder of Celer Network
Deborah Simpier, Co-Founder and CEO of Althea (Gravity Bridge)
Georgios Vlachos, Co-Founder of Axelar

This multisig has been deployed at 0x05e1B9A295aDaF39132FC5bF2b0aEd9FE7C42a2C

The reasoning behind these members is that these would be the key stakeholders for this proposal as they are active community members as well as one representative from each bridge on Evmos.

Additionally, Celer will match this with a minimum of 1m in Celer stablecoin liquidity, which will be deposited into the Celer stablecoin pools.

Weve been working closely with the Axelar Network, Celer Network, Gravity Bridge teams on this initiative. If theres any questions, the Kinesis + Axelar + Celer + Gravity bridge teams will be happy to answer down below.

Background on Axelar Network
Summary:
Axelar network is built from the ground up using Cosmos SDK to interoperate between Cosmos chains, EVM chains, Bitcoin, and other PoS and PoW chains. Satellite is the cross-chain asset transfer app built on top of the network and has amassed over $37m TVL and 100k cross-chain transactions since launching in February. It has also recently become the official canonical bridge for Osmosis and plans to further expand its reach into the Cosmos and EVM ecosystem.

Satellite currently supports Avalanche, Polygon, Terra, Osmosis, Moonbeam, Fantom, Ethereum and Cosmos Hub with plans to support all major EVM chains over the next couple months.

Satellite connects all Cosmos chains via IBC and its GCP protocol with multiple ecosystems.
Its built on top of Axelars decentralized overlay network that connects different blockchain stacks. Axelar serves as the translation layer that allows Cosmos assets to flow freely to all Axelar-interconnected networks and back. It is permissionless, meaning that anyone can join, submit transactions, relay, and validate.

Axelar has been audited by Ackeeblockchain, Cure53, NCC, Oak Security, Commonprefix labs and independent researchers and is also dedicating at least 5% of AXL supply to an insurance fund/program that will help recuperate any stolen funds to ensure the safety of its users.

Security:

Axelar believes that bridging solutions should be at least as secure as the chains being bridged. Axelars solution is having a Cosmos chain, one with a similar validator set to other chains. Additionally, they are heavily invested in securing their smart contracts and in applying cutting-edge cryptography.

The Axelar network isolates functionalities in modules at the Cosmos SDK level, e.g., one module for bitcoin, another for EVM chains, another for IBC transfers, etc.

Each module handles the respective transactions from source and destination chains and are isolated from each other and messages can only be passed through a router module. If there is an issue with one or all chains, a special transfer command that can be supplied by the governance multisig can pause the router module.

There is also minimal reliance on smart contracts and are only used for key-rotations and mint/burn operations.

The mint/burn contracts can also be freezed in case of a compromise and have a rate-limit functionality that allows to minimize how much funds can be stolen in case of an attack. This is not enabled on the mainnet at the moment, but can be considered along with other access control policies to minimize attacks.

There will also be an insurance fund/program of at least 5% of the AXL supply to compensate users in case of stolen funds. Axelar has also been audited by Ackeeblockchain, Cure53, NCC, Oak Security, Commonprefix labs and independent researchers and gone through a dozen audits.

Costs:

Axelar currently has a set fee on each transfer that covers gas costs on source + destination chain. Axelar foundation subsidizes any increase in the destination gas cost if need be and is also considering subsiding fees further from its treasury.

Transactions are also batched, reducing the gas costs for the users significantly. Axelar also has active implementation of threshold signatures that can be used to replace individual validator signatures and further save gas costs. While not currently deployed in EVM contracts, this is just one of the many code-level gas optimizations that Axelar will ship in the future.

Users only pay the fee in the asset they transfer on the source chain, and all other fees (relaying / intermediary / destination chains) are covered by services around the network.

App:
https://satellite.axelar.network/

Background on Celer Network
Summary:
Celer Network is a multi-chain operating system built with Cosmos SDK. Celer released the worlds first EVM-supported inter-chain message SDK. and has a track record of no hacks for any product since Celer originated in 2018.

Celer cBridge is a token bridge application built on top of Celer that supports 45 different tokens across 21 different blockchains and layer-2 rollups. cBridge has $400M TVL and has processed more than $4B of cross-chain volume for 105K unique users with a daily volume of $50M-$60M across 21 different blockchains.

cBridge comes with two security models that every user can choose between, the Cosmos-consensus security model and an optimistic-rollup-style delay buffer security model. The consensus model is security that of a validator-based bridge, while the optimistic rollup style also has a delay buffer to allow an independent watchtower service to double check the message.

Users have single-click UX with fast confirmation of the bridge between source and destination chains and with 2,500-3,500 daily active users comfortable with using Celer Network.


Security:

Cosmos-consensus Security Model:
Celer SGN is running as a Cosmos chain with the same level of liveness assumption which is very high like other Cosmos chains. Celer provides an L1-blockchain level security like Cosmos or Polygon as a Proof-of-Stake chain built on Tendermint with CELR as the staking asset. If a validator acts maliciously, their CELR will be slashed.

Optimistic-rollup-style delay buffer Security Model:
Inter-chain dApps can maintain full security with an optimistic-style delay buffer. Instead of instantly processing a message through the consensus model, one can inject a mandatory delay buffer and run an independent watchtower service to double-validate the message on the source chain. If the watchtower service detects any inconsistency, it can prevent the message from being processed before the delay expires.

For transactions larger than a certain amount, two-transactions are needed to make the bridge happen: a commit transaction that will trigger the time buffer and then after the time buffer, a confirm transaction. The watchtower system also monitors the bridge for small transactions as well to detect and prevent any unexpected smart contract bugs. There is also rate-limiting for token bridging as the last-resort to worst-case scenario.

In addition, Celer cBridge smart contract has been heavily audited and also has a $2M ImmuneFi bug bounty. Celer Network also has a track record since 2018 of no hacking event happening for any product they have built.

Costs:
cBridge charges the gas fee on the destination chain to cover the operation costs of validators. The fee is not related to the size of the transaction, unlike many other bridging solutions.

Celer also has no plans to change the fee structure and remains committed to supporting inter-chain apps where IBC is not available. Unlike other bridges that plan on changing to percentage-based fees later, Celer will only charge a flat fee based on the size of the message passed to provide revenue for validators.

There are also no platform fees charged by the Celer Network for token asset bridging.

App:
https://cbridge.celer.network/#/transfer
Background on Gravity Bridge

Summary:
The Gravity Bridge blockchain is the trustless, neutral bridge between Ethereum and the Cosmos ecosystem. The principal focus of the Gravity community is on providing the most effective and secure bridge possible, instead of a DeFi application on the local chain.

Gravity Bridge protocol focuses on creating a simple bridge design that focuses on providing better security by eliminating design complexity and using non-upgradeable contracts which have been audited by Certick, Least Authority and Cod4rena.

The Gravity Bridge protocol provides strong censorship resistance guarantees and the bridge will remain live as long as the chain remains live, i.e. with more than 2/3 of validators active.

Currently supports Ethereum and has plans to support additional EVM chains before the end of 2022.

While there is not currently a set-aside for an insurance fund, one could easily be set aside from the community pool which contains 50% of $GRAV token distribution which could also contain a collection of assets.

Security:

Gravity Bridge is trustless, decentralized and highly efficient and offers the closest approximation of IBC security possible. It is highly decentralized with all funds directly controlled by validators with slashing to deter validators from acting in bad faith.

The Gravity Bridge design means that the only way to attack the bridge is to go through the validators themselves. This results in a trustless bridge that costs less to operate than a custodial one. It is not possible for a validator to avoid signing a specific transaction or for a relayer to avoid relaying it. Anyone can submit evidence of a signature over a non-protocol message to slash a validator which makes it extremely difficult for validators to steal funds.

The Gravity Bridge, like all bridges, has two components. A Solidity contract on Ethereum and a CosmosSDK module on the Gravity Bridge blockchain.

The solidity contract that holds funds on Ethereum is merely 580 lines of code, which makes it compact and easy to review. It has been audited by three independent teams (Certik, Least Authority, and Code4rena), and it is not upgradable. It requires no trusted parties and can be temporarily paused by governance vote in case of a possible security breach. As a final layer of protection the Gravity Bridge blockchain performs a series of integrity checks that will halt the chain on any unexpected behavior.

While theres nothing set for an insurance fund at the moment, the $GRAV token holders can choose to use some funds from the large community pool to help recuperate stolen funds.

Costs:

Robust relaying reward systems combined with reduced gas costs creates extremely fast & reliable transfers with a decentralized, self-funded, relayer community

Gravity Bridge batches withdraw transactions. This works like a rollup on Ethereum. Executing many transactions in a single shared context is far more efficient than doing so individually. This process provides huge efficiency gains, up to 96% reduction in gas cost.

Once bridge traffic has matured, tx fees could be enabled by the community to sustain the community pool. These tx fees are payable in a wide variety of tokens, not solely in GRAV. Other mechanisms, like a portion of the inflation, could be used to fund the community pool.

App:
https://spacestation.zone/

Background on Kinesis
About Kinesis:
Kinesis is a decentralized automated market maker (AMM) on the EVMOS blockchain, optimized for trading pegged value crypto assets with minimal slippage such as stablecoins. Through Kinesis, all traders can swap their desired stablecoins between EVM compatible blockchains and Cosmos chains.

Kinesis enables efficient, swift, and low-slippage swaps for traders and high-yield for liquidity providers. We believe in collaboration with other Cosmos projects, in maximizing the interoperability of Kinesis, and in building out the stablecoin ecosystem for Cosmos.

Kinesis has no governance token, no admin fees, and no value extraction mechanism. We are building this project as members of the Evmos ecosystem as a public good.
